A teen-aged girl gets the horse of her dreams and is trained by an ex-Jockey to participate in London's Grand National Steeplechase. In the course of her training, the girl meets a charming aristocrat who offers to fix the race for an entry fee of 1,000 pounds in exchanged for a free horse in subsequent years. He arranges for a great horse substitute called The Maharajah to be entered and paid for by a bookmaker.

Although there is melodrama at the center or rather at the bottom of this film, the story is told beautifully and subtly and the acting is superb.

Leland follows the story of Leland P. Fitzgerald (Ryan Gosling), a disaffected teenager who has apparently murdered a severely retarded peer, the brother of popular high school student and athlete MaryAnn Kennedy (Laura Dern). MaryAnn weighs moral response to the issues of what Leland did to her brother and what she should do about it. She and her family try to avoid the world of law enforcement while considering other ways moral responses can affect the case.

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on Miyazawa’s own life, this film depicts our social history at the beginning of the Showa period when the ideological rule of Imperial Japan collapsed. This film also communicates a savage cry for the value system held in juxtaposition to weakness, sins, business and consumerism.
